cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (95 km) SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving W–NW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to turn NW into the Gulf of Mexico and approach the upper Texas–south-central Louisiana coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas or southwest Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches limited to portions of the Bahamas and eastern Cuba (not the Gulf Coast yet)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic, Haiti and nearby islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles this weekend, then entire north-central Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi during mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (sustained 35–45 kt, higher gusts) possible by Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks toward the upper Texas coast, surge of 3–6 ft above ground level is possible in Galveston Bay and adjacent coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 in. of rain with localized higher amounts leading to flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large waves, dangerous rip currents, and possible port-channel shoaling affecting vessel movements
